Would greatly appreciate any guidance on this.

Thank you so much!

title: PASTA DE ENVIADOS DO THUNDERBIRD FICA COM 0 KB DO NADA
content:
Bom dia, gostaria de uma orientação para um problema que ocorreu em algumas máquinas aqui da minha empresa.

Usamos o Thunderbird como cliente de email e em algumas máquinas ocorreu um problema semelhante com a pasta de itens enviados.

Do nada, o usuário abre o thunderbird e na hora de enviar o email aparece uma mensagem dizendo que não é possível copiar a mensagem enviada porque o HD está cheio. Então a pasta de Enviados "some" e quando vou verificar a mesma na pasta de profile pelo explorador, a mesma está com 0 kb e todos os emails armazenados lá sumiram.

Saberiam dizer por que isso acontece e se tem alguma solução para recuperar esses emails?

Detalhe: Não tinha backup da pasta.
creator: contato121

title: Falha na autenticação com OAuth2 no Hotmail
content:
O e-mail principal do meu perfil parou de receber mensagens com o método de autenticação "Senha normal". Por outro lado, o Thunderbird 115.1.0 (64 bits) não pede a senha para autenticação com o método OAuth2.

Quando o sistema tenta receber mensagens, abre-se uma janela com a URL https://login.microsoftonline.com/common/oauth2/v2.0/authorize?response_type=code&client_id=9e5f94bc-xxxx-4e73-b8be-63364c29d753&redirect_uri=https%3A%2F%2Flocalhost&scope=https%3A%2F%2Foutlook.office365.com%2FIMAP.AccessAsUser.All+https%3A%2F%2Foutlook.office365.com%2FPOP.AccessAsUser.All+https%3A%2F%2Foutlook.office365.com%2FSMTP.Send+offline_access&login_hint=xxxx%40hotmail.com, mas ela fecha automaticamente antes de carregar a página para colocar a senha e aparece a mensagem "uncaught exception: 2147500036" no console de erros.

Não existe um token OAuth2 desse e-mail salvo no local das senhas e o Thunderbird não aparece na lista de aplicativos autorizados na conta desse e-mail.

Observação: Algumas contas do Hotmail pediram a senha e estão funcionando corretamente com o método de autenticação OAuth2.
creator: isaacribeiro

title: Importazione dati da Outlook 2016 Mac
content:
Buongiorno, opero su un iMac late 2012 con OS 10.12.6 e Thunderbird 115.1.0 Ho esportato il file da Outlook ottenendo un file .olm. L'ho poi convertito a .mbox con vMail OLM to MBOX Converter.

Tuttavia in Thunderbird posso solo importare dati da Thunderbird, SeaMonkey, Apple Mail e poi c'è un importa file .zip che non ho capito cosa sia. Ho provato a far finta che fosse un profilo di Thunderbird, ma senza successo. Si noti anche che nelle sul link della documentazione relativa all'importazione c'è la possibilità di importare direttamente da Outlook e da Becky (forse per via che è una videata Windows e non Mac). Come faccio ad importare un file .oml, oppure in alternativa un file convertito in MBOX?

Grazie per una cortese risposta

Buona giornata

Maurizio Lanfranco

title: Thunderbird 115.1.0 (64 bit) - Visualizzazione firma
content:
Buonasera,

ho un problema molto particolare con la visualizzazione della firma. La firma è composta da un'immagine e da testo inserito sotto all'immagine. Il testo è molto compatto per occupare poco spazio. Quando si va in nuovo messaggio la firma appare correttamente con il testo "compatto". Quando però la mail viene inviata e finisce nella "Posta inviata", il testo della firma cambia: al testo viene aggiunto uno spazio tra riga e riga. Questo fa si che quando si stampa la mail in pdf, il testo della firma non appare compatto, ma occupa tra immagine e testo metà pagina A4. Allego schermata esplicativa a sinistra quello giusto a destra quello sbagliato. E' possibile ovviare a questo problema? Grazie

title: A Thunderbird hozzáférést kér a Google fiókhoz.
content: Tisztelt Szakértő, Most installáltam a Thunderbird-öt, illetve csak akartam, mivel megjelent egy ablak, amiben a Thunderbird hozzáférést kér a Google fiókhoz. Ez nem lenne baj, de olyan jogosítványokat kér, hogy "mindent megtehessen, amit én megtehetek a Gmailben. Ebbe sajnos olyanok vannak beleértve, mint hogy levelek írása, olvasása, a fiókomban idegen, más e-mail címre szánt e-maileket fogadjon, a nevemben e-maileket küldjön a tudtom nélkül, leveleimet önkényesen törölje. Ha nem fogadom el, nincs levelezés. Ez cenzúra. Muszáj ezt elfogadnom? Kinek fog a nevemben levél menni? Abban kérem segítségét, hogy ezt el tudjam kerülni. Köszönettel: ja8206

title: filters/rules handle messages differently
content:
Dear,

I am using some templates in my Thunderbird 115.1.0 for windows 11 that are AUTO-sent based on certain rules/filters. ie when a revieved e-mail contains a specific word in the message a rule will reply to the message using template 1.

I am now attaching a .gpx file with the template message. The message is sent as usual, but the attachement is not attached to the message (no attachement in the e-mail stored in sent-items). The message is recieved as an message with the added line: "This is a multi-part message in MIME format. --------------TwIF08u4BWQAhVjYA9nsShou Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8 Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit " Also a lot of asci-characters are in the message.

The strange this is: if I sent the very same template manually it all works like a charm. The message is sent with the GPX-file attached to it, and recieved with the complete and functioning attachement.

This leaves me to think Thunderbird handels message automatically differently from manually. Is there any way around this?

Looking forward to your response.

Kind regards.
creator: joostsimkens

title: how do i find which locaL DIRECTORY PATH in thunderbird belongs to which email account i have 3 accounts
content:
Hello,

After a PC crash and power failure, Thunderbird only restarted with one account, and the emails within that account were incorrect. Currently, upon inspecting the local directory, I've noticed the presence of 200 mail files and 200 POP mail files, as indicated in an image. I've already replaced the prefs file with the largest one from before the crash. Additionally, I attempted to import accounts; however, I excluded message import due to the substantial volume (thousands of messages spread across three accounts). While one user was automatically added, I manually added the other account. My primary concern is whether it's possible to rectify the paths for all these files. The situation involves both large folders (approximately 4GB) and smaller ones, all containing a mixture of mail accounts. I'm uncertain if Thunderbird's repair system can handle this intricate scenario. Is there a method to recover and ensure that all messages are correctly attributed to their respective accounts? Any assistance you could provide would be greatly appreciated.
creator: phil_pp

title: Can I create a list of "correspondent" mail IDs from a specific folder of emails?
content:
My email ID is with my ISP (Internet Service Provider). This email ID was created 20 years or so ago, when I didn't know better re having my email ID tied to an ISP. They have decided to be exceedingly unreasonable in rates and I have switched ISPs. But now I need to set up a new e-mail ID; one not associated with an ISP.

I did a search of my Thunderbird email to find all email from the last 25 months (past 2 years plus a one month buffer) and created a Thunderbird folder from that search. I want to extract the email IDs for all "correspondents" from this folder, put it into Excel and filter to remove duplicate correspondents. Then I will cleanse the list of all "correspondents" I do not wish to share my new email ID with and send e-mails to the rest advising those recipients to start using my new email ID.

I have been unsuccessful in several attempts to extract a list. I have the Thunderbird folder created from the search. I can "Select All", but this gets me the contents of all emails rather than the displayed metadata (subject, correspondents, date, location). Note that this folder contains over 5600 entries so I wish to avoid a manual process if at all possible.

Is there a way I can accomplish want I want? Any technique can, but doesn't have to, use the folder of emails created from the search.

Thanks
creator: dgillesp

title: "Get messages" for individual accounts (V 115.1.0)
content:
I just updated Version 102.14.0.0 to Version 115.1.0. Previously I was able to click on "Get Messages" and select which account I wanted to get new messages from. With Version 115, "Get Messages" gets new messages for all my accounts... all 12 of my accounts!

How/where can I change "Get Messages" so it retrieves new messages only for the account I want to get new messages from?
